channel.title: Low framerate in Starcraft II
channel.description:
I've been having some trouble with SCII. From what I've heard the game is not very demanding. I heard an i7 with a GTX260 can max it out with ease and my rig's faster than that.
But I've been experiencing some terrible framerates every now and then. It's not always, but in certain missions on certain spots. For example, in the mission where you have to infiltrate the prison planet with Tosh, my framerate went down to 11FPS at a point.
Specs: i7 920, standard clock 4gb 1600mhz ddr3 memory Club3D 4870X2 2048mb Gigabyte EX-58 UD3R WD Caviar Black 640gb Windows 7 64bit
I have SC II running maxed out at 1680x1050. It also automatically put everything on ultra, so I assume my rig should be easily capable of playing it at max.
Anyone have an idea what might be causing this?

item.title: Low framerate in Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: DEATH_eVADER
item.description:
Daedalus:

Nah that ain’t it, I recently did that and I often check the temperatures, they’re well within normal bounds. Plus, I’ve seen it overheat before and the screen flickers when that happens and artefacts appear along with frequent framedrops.

Does it start of with a good Framerate, then slowly degrades? Have you had this problem with other games?

Read full topic

item.title: Low framerate in Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Daedalus
item.description:
Makes the most sense I guess. I usually have a good frame rate, but at some points in some campaigns it just drops. And the one with Tosh was a planet with a lot of lava, so plenty of particles and what not + constantly moving searchlights etc. I guess this could just have brought a real heavy load all of a sudden?

Well, it seems like there’s not much I can do then. Thanks for the help and suggestions.

Read full topic

item.title: Low framerate in Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Omega_Absolute
item.description:
Harry-UK:

Perhaps the game just isn’t optimised at certain points?

Have there been any other reportings on the internets?

If you go to the SC2 forums, you’ll see many people with the same problems. The game is RIDICULOUSLY unoptimized. It’s not your rig thats messin up.

Read full topic

item.title: Low framerate in Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
ATI’s have a 2d mode as well I think, not sure if that specific glitch is present though.

Read full topic

item.title: Low framerate in Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
His card is an ATI.

Read full topic

item.title: Low framerate in Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Jeannotvb
item.description:
When it starts lagging, does it stay or does it go away if you move away from certain areas?

If it stays then it’s possible your GPU switched to 2d mode which will cause massive performance loss, it’s a fucking annoying glitch from NVIDIA that happens every now and then.

Read full topic

item.title: Low framerate in Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Harry-UK
item.description:
Burbinator:

Maybe those instances are just demanding parts of the game.

His PC clearly walks all over this game. It has to boil down to bad optimisation or some sort of memory fluctuation with a background application?

Read full topic

item.title: Low framerate in Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Maybe those instances where you lag are just demanding parts of the game. In that case, the only solution is turning down the graphics. Other than that, I can’t help you

Read full topic

item.title: Low framerate in Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: Harry-UK
item.description:
Perhaps the game just isn’t optimised at certain points?

Have there been any other reportings on the internets?

item.title: Low framerate in Starcraft II
item.dc:creator: bur
item.description:
Maybe overheating? Check your computer (including heatsink) for dust.
